result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Qulias Allen in court.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Qulias Allen.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea hearing.  Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Qulias Allen in court.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Qulias Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pre-trial. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40. Court orders the Jury Trial date scheduled for September 26th, 2022 VACATED.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-25-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 8-5-2022

filed.
State's Motion in Limine; filed.

Defendant Qulias Allen in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Samuel E. Simpson on behalf of Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense awaiting additional discovery and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Defendant has pending Waukesha case. State ordered to turn over all discovery within 21 days. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within a week of final pretrial. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Case adjourned, Branch 38. **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Qulias Allen in court with Attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Qulias Allen in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Qulias Allen in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Qulias Allen in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Qulias Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
